sentence.text: cell cycle arrest is a p53 target gene with DNA binding function and represents a highly plausible candidate breast cancer predisposition gene.

A germline c.339_340delAG variant predicted to cause premature termination of the protein after 57 alternative amino acid residues was identified in 3/860 families who tested negative for double-strand break repair via homologous recombination and mitotic cytokinesis mutations and in 1/84 sporadic breast cancer cases.

entity.text: double-strand break repair via homologous recombination

sentence.text: However, the variant was also detected in 2/182 families with known double-strand break repair via homologous recombination or mitotic cytokinesis mutations and in 2/464 non-cancer controls.

entity.text: double-strand break repair via homologous recombination

sentence.text: Our data suggest that pathogenic mutations in cell cycle arrest are rare in breast cancer families and the c.339_340delAG variant does not represent a high-penetrance breast cancer risk allele
